modules.description: This module provides operations for ranking, sorting, and statistically evaluating scored classification labels (SL.t) to assess binary classification performance. It computes metrics like ROC/PR curves, AUC values, BEDROC scores, enrichment factors, and calibration-adjusted probabilities via Platt scaling, handling both sorted and unsorted array/list inputs. These tools are specifically used for model evaluation, hyperparameter tuning, and probability calibration in machine learning workflows involving binary outcomes.

Maintains a collection of up to `n` highest-scoring elements, dynamically updating as new elements are added. It stores elements along with their associated float scores, automatically discarding lower-scoring entries when capacity is reached. Useful for tracking top results in search algorithms, recommendation systems, or performance rankings.

This module ranks, sorts, and evaluates scored classification labels to assess binary classification performance. It computes ROC and PR curves, AUC values, BEDROC scores, enrichment factors, and applies Platt scaling for probability calibration. Designed for use with arrays or lists of scored labels, it supports model evaluation, hyperparameter tuning, and calibrated probability estimation in binary machine learning tasks.

This module handles file input/output, list manipulation, and data partitioning for machine learning workflows. It provides functions to read from and write to files, execute shell commands, split and shuffle lists, and generate cross-validation folds. Concrete use cases include loading data from disk, dividing datasets into training and testing subsets, and creating stratified splits for model evaluation.

This module computes regression evaluation metrics including RMSE, MAE, R², and standard deviation of residuals, comparing expected and predicted float lists. It generates raw regression error characteristic curves for visualizing model performance across error thresholds. These functions are used to assess regression models in machine learning tasks like numerical prediction and model comparison.

This module provides tools for evaluating machine learning models, handling data structures, and managing file operations. It includes functions for computing classification metrics like AUC and BEDROC, maintaining top-scoring elements dynamically, calculating regression statistics, and performing list manipulations. Concrete use cases include model evaluation, result tracking in search algorithms, and dataset preparation for training and testing.
